item.title: Appendix A: Standard Environment
item.description: Introduction This section is referred to by other parts of the reference to increase readability and clarity. It is a summary of the Standard Environment provided by creators of CLEAN.

item.title: Appendix A: StdArray
item.description: Basic Operations Indexing Signature $$ \begin{align*} A\rightarrow{i}\rightarrow{R} \end{align*} $$ where : $A$ is of type ${\textbf{T}}$, $i$ is of type $\textbf{Int}$, and $R$ is of type $\textbf{T}$.

item.title: Appendix A: StdBool
item.description: Introduction The StdBool module contains implementation for logical operations. When imported, this module allows for: evaluation of Boolean expressions, and conversion from Boolean type.

item.title: Appendix A: StdChar
item.description: Introduction The StdChar module contains implementation for operations and functions relating to characters. When imported, this module allows for: addition and subtraction between two characters, comparison between two characters, character manipulation, property testing, and conversion to and from character type.

item.title: Appendix A: StdCharList
item.description: Basic Functions cjustify Signature $$ \begin{align*} n\rightarrow{A}\rightarrow{R} \end{align*} $$ where: $n$ is of type $\textbf{Int}$, and $A$ and $R$ are of type $[\textbf{Char}]$.

item.title: Appendix A: StdClass
item.description: Arithmetic Classes PlusMin Declaration 1 2 3 // Language: Clean class PlusMin T | (+ T) & (- T) & (zero T) MultDiv Declaration

item.title: Appendix A: StdInt
item.description: Introduction This section of Appendix A discusses operations and functions defined within Standard Integer and, by extension, the Standard Environment.

item.title: Appendix A: StdList
item.description: Basic Operations Concatenation Signature $$ \begin{align*} A\rightarrow{B}\rightarrow{R} \end{align*} $$ where $A$, $B$, and $R$ are of type $[\textbf{T}]$. Behavior: appends $B$ to the end of $A$.

item.title: Appendix A: StdMisc
item.description: Constants Undefined Entity Implementation 1 2 3 4 // Language: Clean undef :: anyType undef = abort "Run-time error! Program evaluated undefined value?

item.title: Appendix A: StdOrdList
item.description: Basic Functions sort Signature $$ \begin{align*} {A}\rightarrow{R} \end{align*} $$ where: $A$ and $R$ are of type $[\textbf{T}]$. Additionally, equality and relational operations must be defined on $\textbf{T}$.

item.title: Appendix A: StdOverloaded
item.description: Operations Addition Signature $$ \begin{align*} a\rightarrow{b}\rightarrow{R} \end{align*} $$ where: $a$, $b$, and $R$ are of a generic type. Behavior: adds $a$ and $b$.

item.title: Appendix A: StdReal
item.description: Introduction This section of Appendix A discusses operations and functions defined within Standard Real and, by extension, the Standard Environment.

item.title: Appendix A: StdString
item.description: Basic Operations Concatenation Signature $$ \begin{align*} A\rightarrow{B}\rightarrow{R} \end{align*} $$ where $A$, $B$, and $R$ are of type $\textbf{String}$. Behavior: joins$B$ to the end of $A$.

item.title: Appendix A: StdTuple
item.description: Relational Operations Equal To Signature $$ \begin{align*} (\textbf{T}, \textbf{K})\rightarrow(\textbf{T}, \textbf{K})\rightarrow{R} \end{align*} $$ or $$ \begin{align*} (\textbf{T},\textbf{K},\textbf{V})\rightarrow(\textbf{T},\textbf{K},\textbf{V})\rightarrow{R} \end{align*} $$ where: $R$ is of type $\textbf{Bool}$.

item.title: Appendix B: Code recipes
item.description: Table of contents Introduction Breaking an integer into its digits Computing divisors of an integer Checking if an integer is prime or not Introduction This section contains a collection of common and useful functions.
